title.narrative: Emergency livelihood support to La Niña affected pastoral communities in eastern and southern Ethiopia

description.narrative:
Livestock feed supplementation ? 4 community awareness creation/consultation meetings conducted during the first quarter of the project ? 5 LoAs signed with 5 project implementing partners in the first 2 months of the project life ? 25,000 MNBs, 500 quintals (Qt) of urea, and farm tools procured and distributed ? 6,000 heads of cattle core breeding stock belonging to 3,000 vulnerable households equivalent to 18,000 individuals targeted through emergency feeding
Water points rehabilitation ? Improved access to water points for 9,000 households or to 54,000 individuals by improving 12 water points ? 100% of the tools and equipment purchased and transferred to the community.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: La Nina affected zones in Oromia, Ethiopia
La Nina affected zones in Oromia, SNNP and Somali Regions, Ethiopia

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency livelihood support to La Niña affected pastoral communities in eastern and southern Ethiopia

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
